items.author: David Ansen
items.content: Once again Disney has come up with a winning animated feature that has something for everyone on the age spectrum.
What the bright minds of Walt Disney have produced here is a must-see movie. Must-see, must-talk-about, must-plan-to-see-again.

items.author: Liam Lacey
items.content: There's a giddy, absurd charm to the story, in which the strange setting only enhances the comfortable familiarity of the narrative and characters.

items.author: Barbara Shulgasser
items.content: The film will intoxicate children and charm the parents in their company.

items.author: Roger Ebert
items.content: A visionary roller-coaster ride of a movie.

items.author: Owen Gleiberman
items.content: The first animated feature produced entirely on computer is a magically witty and humane entertainment, a hellzapoppin fairy tale about a roomful of suburban toys who come to life when humans aren't around.

items.author: Peter Stack
items.content: A gem of fast action, sophisticated wit and inspired comedy.
The very good news is that, in addition to stylistic innovation, the film sports a provocative and appealing story that's every bit the equal of this technical achievement.

items.author: Jonathan Rosenbaum
items.content: Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar Animation Studios join forces on an entertaining computer-generated, hyperrealist animation feature that's also in effect a toy catalog.

items.author: Susan Wloszczyna
items.content: The first all computer-animated feature, which brings a bedroom of playthings to bouncy life, is yummy eye candy spiked with 3-D-style tactile treats.
